definitions.title: n. f.
definitions.body: concubine (NH id.; Targum:Jer [[פִּילַּקְתָּא]] ([[פַּלְקְתָא]]), perhaps influenced by Gk. pallakh/, pallaki/v (prop. young girl), Lat. pellex; orig. Gk. word acc. to Sta:G. i. 380, cf. also Lewy:Fremdw. 66f; on poss. Hittite origin v. Jen:ZMG xiviii (1894), 468 ff.);—´[[פִּ]] abs. 2Sa 3:7, cstr. 2Sa 21:11, ´[[פִּי]] abs. Ge 36:12, Ju Jdg 19:1, cstr. Ge 35:22 + 4 t.; sf. [[פִּילַגְשׁוֹ]] Ge 22:24 +, [[שֵׁהוּ]]- Ju Jdg 19:24; [[שִׁי]]- Jdg 20:4 + 2 t.; pl. [[פִּלַגְשִׁים]] 2Sa 5:13 + 2 t., ´[[פִּי]] Ge 25:6 + 5 t.; cstr. [[פִּלַגְשֵׁי]] 2Sa 16:21, 2Sa 16:22; sf. [[פִּילַגְשָׁיו]] 2Ch 11:21, [[פִּלַגְשֶׁיְ]] 2Sa 19:6, [[פִּלַגְשֵׁיהֶם]] Ez Eze 23:20; —
either = paramour (perhaps contempt.; o( pa/llac = youth), or < concubinage Ez Eze 23:20 (fig. of Jerusalem doting on Babylon).
